ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I built a better linguistic understanding of the Spanish language and also a better cultural understanding.

I definitely feel like my Spanish skills have improved considerably, and through one of the main projects, P3, I was able to explore something that was really interesting to me in the Spanish language. P3 not only allowed me to learn a lot, but also fueled my passion for learning Spanish because I got a small taste of all of the amazing things that I could be engaging with if I achieve fluency.
I learned how to speak spanish in a conversational way, about the culture of varios spanish speaking countries, and had a really good time in the process.
I learned lots of tenses and vocabulary in this class. We also learned more about life in hispanic countries.

I gained a far broader understanding of Spanish grammar, verb tenses, and vocabulary. Skills of conversation, reading, and writing were developed throughout this course. I also gained much insight into various cultures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I dont think anything can be done to really improve the course. It was structured in a way that helped me to learn a lot and each exam touched a manageable amount of stuff we learned. The class really enforced the collaboration of the class which I liked.
I think that the weaknesses of this course are the daily homework assignments which just felt like busywork. Also, the very rigid structure of Linguameeting is not great.
I loved the professor and how fun the class was. We learned a lot but it was never a stressful or cut-throat environment.
No weaknesses this class was perfect

This course is strong in that you learn lots of information, unfortunately the weakness is that I feel the course does not give you the time to process all of this new information. I know students should do homework outside of class but I wished there was greater emphasis on practicing the language and tenses outside the VHL homework.

Supersite, the homework platform, was helpful. I believe shorter, nightly assignments are necessary for students learning a language so we can practice daily without feeling overwhelmed. There was always sufficient practice given before exams, and the exams were always fairly made and fairly graded. The Wednesday asynchronous day was another strength of the course. The only weakness is the amount of Spanish spoken by the instructor to the students in the course. I believe level 2 Spanish should have the instructor speak just some English, especially when giving instructions and clarifying complex topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend  this course because it helped me to learn a lot and really hone in on my Spanish skills. The structure of the class ensured that I continued to use Spanish.

Yes, definitely. If possible, take it with Professor Alexandrov!! She made the course amazing. I genuinely looked forward to class everyday. I never felt judged and I always felt like I was being pushed to try my best. Professor Alexandrov creates a really special and unique classroom environment, and I'm sorry that not everyone has this Spanish experience.
Absolutely. It is relatively stress free and super fun, but you also learn a lot of spanish and make good friends.
ABsolutely, this course was the highlight of my year here at yale

I would. I love spanish and I grow more in love with it everyday. Also I think this helps get you into enough spanish to be able to begin reading and understanding subtitles and speaking to others. This is a great essential course in the language. Again you learn lots of tenses and vocab that are helpful.

Yes. This course teaches you a lot of the language in one semester. If you are interested in learning the language but willing to put in daily work, this course is for you. Although it is a very difficult course, the daily classes were always enjoyable.
